image.altText: A woman stands by a sink in a bathroom.

props.synopsis: Jenna Lovell's hypermobile spectrum disorder means turning taps and handles can be impossible, but her landlord refused to replace the taps in her home. In Tasmania, she had no recourse other than an anti-discrimination complaint.

title.children: Jenna's landlord refused to make a $200 change so she could access water â€” until she sent a legal letter

image.altText: Tim Walz speaks in front of an American flag.

props.synopsis: Democratic presidential candidate Kamala Harris selects Minnesota Governor Tim Walz to be her running mate in the 2024 election.

title.children: Kamala Harris names Tim Walz as her vice-presidential running mate for 2024 US election

image.altText: A composite of a train POV with a person and a truck crossing a train track

props.synopsis: Pedestrians ambling across tracks seconds before a train passes and vehicles disobeying level crossing signals. Dozens of videos showing rail near misses have been released in a call for better public behaviour near trains.

title.children: Would you risk it? Near misses at level crossings on the rise in Tasmania

image.altText: Arisa Trew with her Olympic gold medal in Paris.

props.synopsis: At just 14 years of age, Arisa Trew shows cools nerves to win the women's park final and eclipse a milestone that has stood since the 1956 Melbourne Olympics, while Australia sets a world record in track cycling's team pursuit. Follow live.

title.children: Skateboarder Arisa Trew becomes Australia's youngest gold medallist, as Aussie cyclists smash a world record

image.altText: Anthony Albanese press conference__45ca69940707cdd3e542a6d38cc18b74

props.synopsis: Tuesday's Reserve Bank outcome looks to have curbed Anthony Albanese's scope for a visit to the governor-general before the end of the year.

title.children: Did the RBA just kill Albanese's early election?

image.altText: A complex of buildings behind fences with trees in front

props.synopsis:
Tasmania's prison service breached the United Nations standard minimum rules with its 'inhumane' treatment of prisoners suspected of concealing contraband, the state's custodial inspector has found.


Â

title.children: 'Inhumane': Tasmanian prisoners left in cells with no running water

image.altText: Elon Musk

props.synopsis: A UK government minister criticised American tech billionaire Elon Musk on Tuesday for "unacceptable" comments on social media about the far-right riots gripping England and Northern Ireland.

title.children: 'Deeply irresponsible': UK justice minister slams Musk for comments about riots

image.altText: Festival-goers at a music festival in Sydney.

props.synopsis: It is one of the big challenges of parenting; setting rules around alcohol with teenagers. Is it a good idea to give them a taste early? Is that even legal?Â

title.children: Can you give your underage teenager alcohol legally? This and other questions about youth drinking answered

image.altText: Kamala Harris standing at a podium with Tim Walz behind her.

props.synopsis: Democratic presidential candidate Kamala Harris says her vice-president pick Tim Walz "will be ready from day one" at rally in Philadelphia. Follow live.

title.children: Kamala Harris says campaign is a 'fight for the future' at first address with running mate Tim Walz

image.altText: A close up of Yahya Sinwa at a rally among a crowd of people.

props.synopsis: The announcement comes almost a week after Ismail Haniyeh was killed by a blast in Iran.

title.children: Hamas announces Yahya Sinwar as new leader after assassination of Ismail Haniyeh

image.altText: Michelle Bullock speaking in front of a wall covered in Reserve Bank of Australia logos.

props.synopsis: Despite what the Reserve Bank governor has said, many people expect interest rates will have to come down â€” possibly sooner than predicted.

title.children: Many think the RBA will have to cut rates well before inflation is where it wants it. Here's why

image.altText: Small fossil bone in palm of hand.

props.synopsis: The discovery of a 700,000-year-old arm bone fossil and two teeth on the Indonesian island of Flores is shedding light on how the tiny, now-extinct human Homo floresiensis evolved.

title.children: This tiny arm bone fossil sheds light on the early human species known as the 'hobbit'

image.altText: Department of Justice on a building with american flag behind.

props.synopsis: A Pakistani man with alleged ties to Iran has been charged in the United States in connection with a foiled plot to assassinate a US politician or government officials, the Department of Justice says.Â

title.children: US charges man with alleged ties to Iran in foiled assassination plot

image.altText: A man wearing glasses smiles.

props.synopsis: Nobel laureate Muhammad Yunus will head Bangladesh's interim government after former prime minister Sheikh Hasina stepped down and fled the country amid a mass uprising against her rule.

title.children: A Nobel laureate will head an interim government in Bangladesh after unrest ousted Hasina

image.altText: A man and woman, with their baby in a pram, looking at the ASX stock market boards in Sydney.

props.synopsis: A sense of calm has returned on Wall Street, with investors jumping back into the market after three days of sell-offs. The Australian share market is set to open slightly lower. Follow the day's events withÂ our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.Â

title.children: Calm returns to global markets, with ASX poised to open slightly lower after Wall Street rebounds

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Who is paying the price for slowing inflation?
Did the market overreact to US data and Japan rates?
Does the RBA have fears of a US recession?

image.altText: A doctor holds a stethoscope in two clasped hands

props.synopsis: Doctors over the age of 70 are more likely to receive a complaint, prompting the Australian medical board to propose regular health checks in order for them to continue working.

title.children: Spike in complaints against older doctors prompts call for regular health checks

image.altText: Frances Haugen portrait looks down the barrel of the camera

props.synopsis: Facebook whistleblower Frances Haugen smuggled out tens of thousands of documents that proved the tech giant knew the harms the platform caused to children. Years later she says Australia is at risk of fumbling an opportunity to regulate social media.

title.children: Will Australia blow its 'once-in-a-decade' chance to regulate social media?

image.altText: A composite of three gold medal winners. Left to right: Noemi fox, cam mcevoy and Saya Sakakibara

props.synopsis: Australia has to win a few more gold medals to beat any records this Olympic Games.Â

title.children: How well is Australia doing in the Paris 2024 Olympics?

image.altText: Oliver Bleddyn and Conor Leahy ride arm-in-arm

props.synopsis: Australia's male cycling stars have enjoyed a morning to remember as the team pursuit quartet set a new world record, while the team sprint trio added to the country's medal tally.

title.children: Australia's men's cycling team smash team pursuit world record, win team sprint bronze medal

image.altText: Hanah Green tees off during the second round of the Australian Open.

props.synopsis: Here's everything that's going to happen on day 12 of the Olympic Games.

title.children: Olympics schedule day 12: Hannah Green and Minjee Lee tee off and Matthew Denny's big throw

image.altText: a soldier with a blue scarf covering his mouth

props.synopsis: Experts say the apparent fall of the military command centre poses yet more serious questions about the military junta's capability and the future of its senior leadership.

title.children: 'Divorced from reality': How the fall of a key military post raises fresh questions about the Myanmar military's capability and leadership

image.altText: A protestor holds a Bangladesh flag in front of a flaming car in Dhaka

props.synopsis: The weeks of protests have come to fruition, at a heavy cost. What do Bangladeshis want now?

title.children: What next after the removal of Bangladesh's 'Iron Lady'?

image.altText: Principal Johnson playing a board game with students in a classroom.

props.synopsis: Despite featuring in some state and territory curriculums, research suggests very little is being taught on climate change, with some teachers actively avoiding the topic as "too controversial" or "too hard".

title.children: How these young students are learning about climate change in a way that keeps them 'hopeful'

image.altText: A black-and-white photo of a runner with his coach.

props.synopsis: When running legend Herb Elliott won gold in 1960, he did so in a time that would have secured him a spot in the final at the Paris Olympics six decades later â€” and the sporting partnership that helped achieve that remarkable feat is now being celebrated on the silver screen.

title.children: Running uphill through sand, an eccentric visionary helped pave the path to gold

image.altText: Arisa Trew competing in the women's skateboarding at the Paris Olympics.

props.synopsis: Some simple advice from her coach was all 14-year-old skateboarder Arisa Trew needed to come from behind and capture Australia's 14th gold medal of the Paris Olympics.

title.children: 'You've just got to go all out': How an Aussie teenager wrote herself into the Olympic record books

image.altText: Jock Landale of Australia puts his hands on his head during a basketball game against Serbia at the Paris Olympics.

props.synopsis: The Boomers' knockout loss to Serbia had all the hallmarks of the pre-2021, including some brilliance from Patty Mills and, of course, a result as heart-pounding as it was heart-breaking.

title.children: Back to bedlam for Boomers as Paris campaign ends in overtime loss to Serbia

image.altText: Australian diver Melissa Wu underwater after a dive at the Paris Olympics.

props.synopsis: Sydney teenager Ellie Cole finishes a superb seventh in the Olympic women's 10m platform final, four places ahead of her record-breaking hero Melissa Wu.

title.children: Aussie diving great Wu happy to pass torch to â€˜inspiringâ€™ teen teammate Cole

image.altText: A group of three Olympic medals - with silver, gold and bronze left to right - are shown against a dark background.

props.synopsis: Keep up with how many medals Aussie athletes have won today â€” and where Australia sits on the leaderboard.Â

title.children: Here's the medal standings after day 11 of the Olympic Games

image.altText: A bottle of penfolds wine being poured.

props.synopsis: Ultra-premium wine collectors have snapped up a new commemorative bottle of Penfolds, but what is driving the hefty high price tags for luxury drops?

title.children: This $18,000 bottle of Australian wine sold out before it was released

image.altText: A barista performs coffee art while pouring milk from a jug into a cup of coffee.

props.synopsis: This year droughts are pushing coffee prices to record highs, but climate change means it's unlikely we'll ever see a return to the $3 flat white.

title.children: Yes, your flat white is costing you more â€” and climate change on the other side of the world is making things worse

image.altText: A large white dome that houses low-level radioactive waste.

props.synopsis: For decades, the issue of where to put Australia's nuclear waste has caused friction in regional communities and frustration for federal politicians on both sides. A possible solution has now emerged.Â

title.children: Beneath the WA outback lies low-level radioactive waste and a lesson for governments

image.altText: Australian authorities approach a suspected illegal fishing boat spotted at Kuri Bay in far northern WA.

props.synopsis: Australian authorities have responded after local tour guides and traditional owners spotted four boats moored at Kuri Bay in far northern WA.

title.children: Border protection officials intercept four boats in far northern Western Australia

image.altText: A woman in a wide-brimmed hat sits on a deckchair on a sandy beach, watching the ocean.

props.synopsis: Paid long service leave remains an entrenched Australian value and serves to reward long-serving employees, including casual and part-time workers, by providing them with an extended period of additional paid time-off. But what exactly are your entitlements?

title.children: Are you entitled to long service leave and how do you access it?

image.altText: A white hurricane cloud cluster with a long tail is seen from space over a blue-green ocean with the US visible underneath

props.synopsis: The weather system continued to batter coastal regions with flooding and high winds as it was downgraded on Monday to a tropical storm.

title.children: Hurricane Debby makes landfall as US south flooded â€” warning of 'once-in-a-thousand-year' rain event

image.altText: An Olympics official bends down to place a discus in the sun roof of an RC

props.synopsis: Those small cars darting across the background of track and field events have a big role behind the scenes. Here's what they do.Â

title.children: Have you spotted a mini car at the Olympics? They serve an important purpose
